item.title: Graphing library in PHP
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

it’d probably be better aesthetically, but I only kept the x/y axis seperated for simplicity. As I said, I only did this out of boredom, I’m not going to make any further attempts to improve it from now on but thank you all for your comments.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphing library in PHP
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“newbiehacker, post:21, topic:164707”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=223580.msg1932145#msg1932145 date=1197753476]

[me=Thug life] Claps[/me]
Yeah but, no one is going to keep deleting cookies then refresh, repeat. Just to mess up a graph.

But it is one-click in Opera to simply disable cookies.
[/quote]
You can do that in firefox too, although now the system doesn’t use cookies for checking.

The grid isn’t evenly spaced as it draws from 0 (or a negative value) to the highest value along each axis. so the divisions between the x-axis would be width / values, and divisions along the y-axis would be height/values, so of course they’re not the same.[/quote]

would it not be better to make a set size? like a grid size of 5 px which is = to 5 in the bar graph (and not according to the max value)

this is just a suggestion

Read full topic

I got a small suggestion anyway, if there’s more than x page-views in x amount of time, block the user for 5 minutes

item.title: Graphing library in PHP
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:14, topic:164707”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=223580.msg1932092#msg1932092 date=1197752249]
[me=Thug life] Claps[/me]
Yeah but, no one is going to keep deleting cookies then refresh, repeat. Just to mess up a graph.
[/quote]

But it is one-click in Opera to simply disable cookies.[/quote]
You can do that in firefox too, although now the system doesn’t use cookies for checking.

The grid isn’t evenly spaced as it draws from 0 (or a negative value) to the highest value along each axis. so the divisions between the x-axis would be width / values, and divisions along the y-axis would be height/values, so of course they’re not the same.

Read full topic

[me=Thug life] Claps[/me]
